content.raw:
@{557058:cbf1bc43-1dc2-477b-9e25-1a8f40fd7ee3} @{557058:a70cc9cf-684e-4849-a61a-9ade4d7218b5}  This is going to need reworking before we can merge.

I think it’s still a good idea to do, but we need to resolve the merge conflict. I’ve also realised that the line with the conflict \(`process_tree.zlock_client.set_process_name('lyse-'+os.path.basename(filepath))`\) is going to need to use the lyse port included or else it’s going to conflict with scripts with the same name connected to another instance of lyse. I’m not sure what the consequences of that overlap are, but it would be best to correct in case it becomes a problem down the line.

‌
content.html:
@Chris Billington @Jan Werkmann This is going to need reworking before we can merge.

I think it’s still a good idea to do, but we need to resolve the merge conflict. I’ve also realised that the line with the conflict (process_tree.zlock_client.set_process_name('lyse-'+os.path.basename(filepath))) is going to need to use the lyse port included or else it’s going to conflict with scripts with the same name connected to another instance of lyse. I’m not sure what the consequences of that overlap are, but it would be best to correct in case it becomes a problem down the line.

‌
